definition[0]: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past
example[1]: I can’t remember her exact words.
example[2]: I remember it well; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
example[3]: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
example[4]: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
example[5]: They had three children, if I remember rightly.
example[6]: They’ve lived here for as long as I can remember.
example[7]: No one got drunk as far as I can remember.
example[8]: I remember you two couldn’t stand each other at first!
example[9]: I remember meeting her at a party once.
example[10]: I remember my father bringing home a huge Christmas tree.
explanation[0]: The verb remember is not usually used in the progressive in this meaning You say
explanation[1]: You often say someone can remember something when describing what they remember
explanation[2]: Do not use ‘remember about’ in this meaning You say
bad_example[1]: Do you remember about that day?
definition[1]: to bring information or facts that you know into your mind
example[14]: You left your keys on the table, remember?
example[15]: I can’t remember her phone number.
example[16]: I suddenly remembered that I’d left the stove on.
example[17]: I called the office, but I don’t remember who I spoke to.
definition[2]: to not forget something that you must do, get, or bring
example[18]: I hope he remembers the wine.
example[19]: Remember to take your P.E. clothes to school.
definition[3]: to keep a particular fact about a situation in your mind
example[20]: Remember, processed food is usually full of salt and sugar.
example[21]: Remember that not everyone has as much money as you.
example[22]: It should be remembered that a lot of work went into this event.
definition[4]: to think with respect about someone who has died, often in a ceremony
example[23]: On this day we remember the dead of two world wars.
definition[5]: to give someone a present on a particular occasion
note[6]: remember somebody in your will (=arrange for someone to have something of yours after you die)
example[24]: Lilian always remembers me at Christmas.
example[25]: I remember so well my first day there.
example[26]: I remember clearly how I used to feel as a child in church on Sundays.
example[27]: He could vaguely remember his mother’s face.
example[28]: The restaurant is fondly remembered by many.
example[29]: You were still at school, if I remember rightly.
definition[6]: to form an idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past
example[31]: I remember Janine – she lived in that house on the corner.
example[32]: I can’t remember how the film ends.
example[33]: He remembered meeting her at a party once.
definition[7]: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation, especially in order to tell someone about it
example[34]: Can you recall where your husband was that night?
example[35]: She recalled that he had seemed a strange, lonely man.
definition[8]: to remember an event or situation
example[36]: Harry smiled as he recollected the scene.
example[37]: She tried to recollect what had happened next in her dream.
definition[9]: to learn facts, a piece of writing or music etc, so that you can remember them later
example[38]: He’s trying to memorize his speech.
example[39]: Don’t write down your PIN number, memorize it.
definition[10]: to think about something that happened in the past
example[40]: I thought back to when I was his age.
example[41]: Looking back, I should have been more patient with her.
example[42]: We need to stop looking back and start thinking about the future.
definition[11]: to talk about pleasant events, people, experiences etc from the past, because you want to remember them or enjoy talking about them
example[43]: They were reminiscing about old times.
example[44]: I used to spend hours listening to my grandfather reminisce.
definition[12]: to remember something important when you are doing something, because it could affect what you do
example[45]: Bear in mind that this is the first time he’s done this.
display[6]: something is on the tip of your tongue
definition[13]: used to say that you know a word or a name but that you have difficulty remembering it at this exact moment
example[46]: His name’s on the tip of my tongue. I’ll think of it in a minute.
definition[14]: to make you think of another person, thing, or time, because they are similar
example[47]: It reminds me of the time when I first started teaching.
example[48]: The taste reminded him of school dinners.
